intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: Approximately, how many Starbucks locations are there in Rhode Island?
questions.explanation: The chain has around 30 locations in Rhode Island, including one in Wayland Square and another downtown. The Thayer Street location closed down last week.

questions.question: What percentage of college students in the United States were diagnosed with a cold or respiratory illness in the past year?
questions.explanation: About 35% of all college students in the United States were reported to be diagnosed with a cold or other respiratory illness in the past year.

questions.question: Which of the following could pose challenges to the University’s budget, according to Provost Doyle?
questions.explanation: Federal financial aid changes, an increased endowment tax and immigration-related barriers inhibiting master’s student enrollment could pose challenges for the University’s budget, Doyle said at the meeting.

questions.question: What is Brown women's soccer's current ranking in the Ivy League?
questions.explanation: Brown women’s soccer is now tied with Harvard for second place in the Ivy League. They beat Penn 4-0 in a pink-out on Saturday night.

questions.question: How many students are currently participating in the Conversation Partners Program?
questions.explanation: 42 students have been paired with 40 staff members to practice their conversational English. Though the program is open to all multilingual students, it is mainly focused on international grad students.

questions.question: Which Pulitzer-winning author gave a talk at the Cogut Institute on Monday?
questions.explanation: At a Monday evening event at the Cogut Institute for the Humanities, Pulitzer Prize-winning author Jhumpa Lahiri spoke about writing across various languages, her relationship with perfectionism and her upbringing in Rhode Island.

questions.question: How many universities, including Brown, were asked to sign the Trump administration’s “Compact for Academic Excellence in Higher Education?”
questions.explanation: Nine schools were sent the proposal. Penn and Dartmouth were the only other Ivy League schools to receive the offer.

questions.question: This weekend, Brown women’s volleyball swept which team for the first time?
questions.explanation: This historic weekend marked the team’s first ever sweep at Princeton, and their first reverse sweep since 2022.

questions.question: By how much has homelessness in Rhode Island decreased in the last year?
questions.explanation: Homelessness in Rhode Island has decreased by 2.8%, according to a report released last month by the Rhode Island Coalition to End Homelessness.

questions.question: How many tracks does Taylor Swift’s new album “The Life of a Showgirl” contain?
questions.explanation: Released on Oct. 3, Swift’s 12th studio album has only 12 tracks and signals a new era in her discography.
